doc:
Charles Barton (director) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Barton_(director) 0 Charles Barton (May 25, 1902 – December 5, 1981) was a film and vaudeville actor and film director. He won an Oscar for best assistant director in 1933. His first film as a director was the Zane Grey feature Wagon Wheels, starring Randolph Scott, in 1934. Charles_Barton ( May_25_,_1902 – December_5 , 1981 ) was a_film_and_vaudeville_actor_and_film_director . He won an_Oscar for best_assistant_director in 1933 . His_first_film as a_director was the_Zane_Grey_feature_Wagon_Wheels , starring Randolph_Scott , in 1934 .
